intro: Leichhardtia fraseri, commonly known as the pink ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, pale pink to white, almost translucent petals. The plant typically grows as a low, mat-forming shrub with hairy stems and small, elliptical leaves. It produces clusters of showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom during the wet season. Leichhardtia fraseri is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils and open woodlands.
